post.description: Uses the Z.AI chat API endpoint for completion, enables reasoning.

parameters.description: Mandatory. Needs to be 'Bearer <Z.AI_API_KEY>', automatically set by JAI if you put in your Z.AI API key in the proxy config.
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Optional. For running locally: If available, reasoning will be logged to console.
parameters.name: logReasoning

post.description: Uses the Z.AI coding API endpoint for completion, enables reasoning.

parameters.description: Mandatory. Needs to be 'Bearer <Z.AI_API_KEY>', automatically set by JAI if you put in your Z.AI API key in the proxy config.
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Optional. For running locally: If available, reasoning will be logged to console.
parameters.name: logReasoning

post.description: Uses OpenRouter endpoint for completion, enables reasoning.

parameters.description: Optional. Enables use of a preset configured in your OpenRouter account, e.g. to set the system prompt or customise providers. Example:
parameters.name: preset

parameters.description: Optional. For running locally: If available, reasoning will be logged to console.
parameters.name: logReasoning

parameters.description: Mandatory. Needs to be 'Bearer <OpenRouter_API_KEY>', automatically set by JAI if you put in your OpenRouter API key in the proxy config.
parameters.name: authorization

post.description: Translates a JAI request into a Google AI request, sends it to GAI, then translates the response back to JAI format.

parameters.description: Mandatory. Needs to be 'Bearer <GoogleAI_API_KEY>', automatically set by JAI if you put in your Google AI Studio API key in the proxy config.
parameters.name: authorization

parameters.description: Optional. Sets "system instructions" which the model will adhere more strictly to. LOCAL loads the system prompt in the server file system, i.e. systemprompt.md - use if you are running it locally, or you want to use the server's "default" system prompt. CONTEXT reads whatever contents put between <systemprompt>...</systemprompt> in the first message of the conversation and uses that as the system prompt. If not specified, no system prompt is set.
parameters.name: systemPromptMode

parameters.description: Optional. Lets you set a determined number of tokens the model may use for reasoning, if you are using a model that is capable of reasoning. Setting this to a positive integer can force gemini-2.5-flash into reasoning mode. For flash: 0 to 24576, for pro: 128 to 32768. -1 lets the model decide.
parameters.name: reasoningEffort

parameters.description: Optional. For running locally: If available, reasoning will be logged to console.
parameters.name: logReasoning
